title: Define Project Scope and Requirements (v2)
description:
This RFC aims to clearly outline the legal documents to be generated by the LegalDocumentGenerator system. The system should support user inputs, jurisdictional requirements (including specific countries/states), document formats, and additional features such as multi-language support, document proofreading, and integration with popular law practice management systems. Detailed examples of user inputs for each type of document are required. For this RFC, provide a comprehensive list of all possible legal documents that can be generated along with the corresponding jurisdictional requirements. Additionally, identify potential edge cases or exceptions that may arise during generation.

**Examples of User Inputs:**
- For a non-disclosure agreement: company name, parties involved, duration, and any specific clauses.
- For a sales contract: product/service details, price, payment terms, delivery schedule, warranty information, etc.

**Possible Legal Documents:**
1. Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs)
   - Jurisdictional Requirements: Worldwide
2. Sales Contracts
   - Jurisdictional Requirements: United States, United Kingdom, European Union countries
3. Lease Agreements
   - Jurisdictional Requirements: United States (varies by state)
4. Employment Contracts
   - Jurisdictional Requirements: United States, United Kingdom, European Union countries
5. Patent Applications
   - Jurisdictional Requirements: Worldwide (specific to patent office)
6. Trademark Registrations
   - Jurisdictional Requirements: Worldwide (specific to trademark office)
7. Licensing Agreements
   - Jurisdictional Requirements: Worldwide

title: Design Architecture for LegalDocumentGenerator
description: Plan the overall structure of the system, including frontend, backend, and any necessary APIs or integrations.

title: Develop User Interface for Input Collection
description: Create the frontend interface where users can input their requirements.

title: Create Backend Services for Document Generation
description: Develop the backend services that will generate the legal documents based on user inputs and jurisdictional requirements.

title: Integrate Database for Storing User and Document Data
description: Setup and integrate a database to store user information, document templates, and generated documents.

description: Create tests to ensure each component of the system is functioning as intended.
